about.title: About me
about.description: Hello! I'm Mohammed Ilef, a recent computer science graduate with a passion for technology. I love solving problems by developping robust software and scalable solutions using modern technologies. My academic background, personal projects, and professional experiences have equipped me with the skills and readiness to embrace new challenges and opportunities.

fikra.title: Fikra
fikra.description: This full-stack project is a platform for developers to share their pet project ideas. It includes CRUD operations on posts. Currently, I am working on the authentication and authorization for the app. The frontend is built with React, TypeScript, and TailwindCSS, while the backend uses NestJS, TypeScript, PostgreSQL, and Prisma. For the CI/CD process, I am using GitHub Actions and Render (with the free tier for continuous delivery). The production database is hosted on Supabase.

sortingAlgorithm.title: Sorting Algorithm Visualiser
sortingAlgorithm.description: A simple app made with vanilla JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. The goal of the app is to visualize the sorting of pipes for each sorting algorithm. The user can generate as many pipes as they want with random lengths, then press the start button to sort them. The execution time is displayed once the sorting is completed. The app is hosted on GitHub Pages.

passwordGenerator.title: Password Generator
passwordGenerator.description: A password generator app made with React, TypeScript, and Styled Components. The user can choose the criteria for the password and generate as many as they want. The app is documented in the README file on GitHub. It is hosted on GitHub Pages.
